attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description: A stock take exercise was conducted on 1st June 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place i.e. Raw Materials, Finished Goods, and Polybags & Miscellaneous.
attributes.recommendation: Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.effect: Minimal stock variances imply strong controls.

value: The stock is within the established limits.
Stock is within the acceptable limit. The excess Utto is as a result of introduction of new tins.

In the prior Audit, the following were the stock findings.

Ø  Bread variance- (-53.5 loaves)

Ø  Polybags- (+475 pcs)

Ø  Crates-   (-5 pcs)
Previous
A stock take exercise was conducted on 1st June 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place
No significant variances were noted in stock.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Strong Internal Controls are Put in Place.

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Packed bread samples were weighed on 01/06/2025 to establish if product released to the market was of the desired quantity.

From the selected sample 200g SB - 11% was found to be underweight.
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: Few cases of underweight imply bread weight standards are adhered to.

value: Bread weight is within the required limit.
The few cases of underweight bread were caused by a slicing machine breakdown and overcooling due to delays by the slicers.

Both sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 11% and 400g W- 5%.
Previous
Bread Weight is done for all the varieties.
Compliance was met, with minimal cases of underweight bread.
Operations/Production Department
To establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Production and market damages were analyzed to determine their rate during production or from market and compare the same with the allowed standards. High production damage rate would suggest product of inferior quality was allowed to the market.

Allowed production damages rate is 0.25% of total production and market damage is 0.2% of net sales.

Production and market damage rate was analyzed from cash flow date 22/04/2025 - 31/05/2025.

It was noted that market damages slightly exceeded the set limit, while production damages remained within the established thresholds, as illustrated below.
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality controls to minimize market damages.
attributes.effect:
Production damages were within acceptable limits, indicating no impact on revenue targets.
However, slightly elevated market damages suggest a need to strengthen control measures.

value: Within the set limit.

Bread expiry occurred due to overproduction beyond market demand.

The absence of sales forecasts for the last two weeks of May 2025 may have contributed as well.

A total of 815 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.19% of the total loaves produced.

2,874 loaves were damaged under market damages (market returns and expired bread) representing 0.5% of the total sales over the audited period.

Market damages exceeded the set limit by 1,713 loaves worth Ksh. 91,645
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
Both production and market damages were within the allowed limits.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring bread damages are managed to set tolerable levels.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

No material variance was noted.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards
attributes.effect: Minor variances is an indication of strong controls.

value: This is noted and will be maintained
We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers.

There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

   No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.
Previous
Comparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 22nd April to 31st May 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System.
The controls are strong.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Physical cash was verified on 02/06/2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

       No material Variance was noted.
attributes.recommendation: Observed cash control is commendable.
attributes.effect: Cash loss risk is minimal. This implies strong controls.

value: The cash controls are effective and will be maintained.
Cash controls are effective.
No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 02/06/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Spot checks were done on the branch minishops to find out if they were run as per the company policy.

On the spot-check days, no issue of non-compliance was noted in the visited minishops. (Mtwapa, Kivulini, Shanzu and Matsangoni)
attributes.recommendation: The Minishop controls should be strengthened even more.
attributes.effect: Minishop SOPs are being observed. This indicates strong controls.

value: Well noted and will be maintained.
To be maintained.

Stock variances were noted in Mtwapa- Ksh. 3,799, Kanamai- Ksh. 749 and Shanzu- Ksh. 3,852

Below are the details of the findings
Previous
Spot check was done on the 2nd day of audit. Loadings in the manager ‘s and guard’s book are compared with the STN used for loading the mini shop.
The controls were effective at Mini shops.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the DDS balance reconciles with physical stock.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production efficiencies were analyzed from 22/04/25 – 31/05/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

Actual production efficiency was 4.43 bags per worker which is slightly below the set limit.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to work towards achieving the set KPI.
attributes.effect: The Production efficiency was slightly below the KPI. This implies extra cost of KES 33,467 was incurred to hire extra production workers.

value: This is well noted.
Breakdown of the slicing machine affected the production efficiency.

The branch hired a total of 474 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,370 bags.

The actual production was 2,235 bags leading to a production shortfall of 135 bags.
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production efficiency was adhered to. 

Standard production efficiency is 5 bags per staff.
The production efficiency was not achieved.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is adhered to.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description: Packing efficiencies were analyzed from 22/04/25 – 31/05/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should ensure proper planning to address noted packing inefficiency.
attributes.effect: The set efficiency was not achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was not observed.

value:
Well noted.

Packing efficiency is within the set limit.
Breakdown of the Slicing Machine affected the efficiency.

The total bread produced over the audited period is 31,869 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 329 workers.

The branch hired the exact packers required leading to a packaging efficiency of 96.9 crates per packer which is within the range.

The set efficiency was attained.
Previous
Packaging efficiency was analyzed from 22.04.25 – 31.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per packer.
The packing efficiency was close to KPI
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set packing efficiency is attained.

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage & Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of motor vehicle fuel purchase and usage was done from 22/04/25 - 31/05/25 assess compliance to company policies and results were analyzed on the below table

It was noted that the fuel consumption for vehicle KDH 926N was within the established standard rate, demonstrating adequate control. However, vehicles KBZ 514T, KTWD 211G, and KTWD 212G currently lack defined standard fuel consumption rates.
attributes.recommendation: It is recommended to continue monitoring fuel consumption closely.
attributes.effect: Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs

value: Well noted and will be maintained.
While controls are being maintained, the Transport Manager is yet to provide a response or submit the standard rates for the KBZ vehicle and two the TuTuks(KTWD 211G & KTWD 212G).
No previous Findings.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Fuel consumption was as per expected set standards.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
•       Fuel consumption tests were carried out to determine if set consumption standards for sales vans were adhered to.

•       Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 16.89 L/HR

•       Generator fuel consumption from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 is analyzed on the below table.

•       It was noted that the average fuel consumption was 18.82 l/hr which is slightly above the standard rate by 1.93l/hr.
attributes.recommendation: Continue periodic monitoring to ensure the rate remains within acceptable limits.
attributes.effect: The high generator fuel consumption, when compared to the implied standard rate, suggests ineffective controls over fuel usage.

value: The average consumption rate is slightly above the set rate.
The controls will be strengthened.
·        The average fuel consumption rate was 16.7 Ltrs per hour which is within the range.
Previous

The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
The average consumption rate was slightly above the set standard rate.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring economical fuel consumption by the generator.
